executiveSummary:
The Project Opportunity Assistant is an AI-powered freelance project discovery and proposal management system designed specifically for solo entrepreneurs and JavaScript/TypeScript developers seeking remote project-based work. The system addresses the critical inefficiency where freelancers waste 10+ hours weekly manually browsing fragmented platforms, writing repetitive proposals, and missing 70% of relevant opportunities due to timing and platform fragmentation. By providing intelligent project-candidate matching, AI-powered proposal generation, and competitive pricing intelligence, the system transforms the freelance opportunity discovery process from a time-consuming manual task into an efficient, data-driven workflow.

The system operates through a comprehensive project pipeline that begins with manual project input from major freelance platforms (Upwork, Freelancer.com, Contra, Fiverr Pro, PeoplePerHour, Guru.com) and progresses through intelligent matching, proposal generation, and bid tracking. The matching algorithm uses project-specific weights emphasizing skill overlap (35%), budget alignment (25%), and project complexity matching (20%), while the proposal generation system creates both short (200-400 words) and detailed proposals with multiple variants tailored to different client preferences. The pricing intelligence system provides three tiers of guidance, from simple budget-based suggestions to advanced win/loss analytics that learn optimal pricing strategies over time.

Targeting JavaScript/TypeScript developers from South Asia who face geographic restrictions on many platforms, the system prioritizes freelance platforms with global accessibility and high technical project volume. The solution serves solo AI-powered entrepreneurs who leverage AI tools for service delivery, technical consultants seeking contract opportunities, and full-stack developers pursuing both employment and freelance work simultaneously. The system maintains complete user privacy through local deployment while providing enterprise-level functionality for individual professionals.

Architecturally, the Project Opportunity Assistant operates as an independent system within a multi-PRD ecosystem, sharing infrastructure with the Core Job Assistant (PRD-001) while maintaining separate business logic and data pipelines. Built on the same loosely-coupled plugin architecture using Ports and Adapters pattern, the system supports future expansion to automated scraping, social media monitoring, and integration with a standalone Proposal Builder MCP service. This foundation ensures zero infrastructure costs, complete data privacy, and seamless scalability as the freelance opportunity landscape evolves.
problemStatement: Solo AI-powered freelancers and one-person companies waste 10+ hours/week manually browsing fragmented freelance platforms, writing repetitive proposals, and tracking bid statuses. They miss 70% of relevant project opportunities due to timing and platform fragmentation. JavaScript/TypeScript developers from South Asia face additional challenges finding remote-friendly platforms without geographic restrictions. Existing solutions lack intelligent project-candidate matching, AI-powered proposal generation, and competitive pricing intelligence.
targetUsers: Solo AI-powered entrepreneurs running one-person companies using AI tools to deliver work
JavaScript/TypeScript freelancers seeking remote project-based work
South Asian developers targeting global remote freelance opportunities without geographic restrictions
Technical consultants seeking contract opportunities on freelance platforms
Full-stack developers pursuing both employment and freelance projects simultaneously
inScope: Manual project opportunity input system supporting URL import, text paste, and form entry
Integration with major freelance platforms prioritizing South Asian developer accessibility
AI-powered project-candidate matching with project-specific weighting algorithm
Three-tier pricing intelligence system from basic budget analysis to advanced win/loss learning
AI-powered proposal generation supporting short and detailed proposal variants
Comprehensive bid and proposal tracking pipeline separate from job applications
Project-specific dashboard and user interface with advanced filtering and sorting
Unified search capabilities across both projects and jobs
Plugin-ready architecture supporting future automated scraping and social media monitoring
Event-driven communication system using BullMQ for scalable processing
Telegram Bot integration for notifications and quick project updates
Shared infrastructure integration with PRD-001 while maintaining independent business logic
outOfScope: Social media monitoring for project opportunities
Job search features covered by PRD-001
Backup and disaster recovery covered by PRD-004
Direct messaging to clients on platforms
objectives: Reduce time spent on project discovery from 10+ hours to under 2 hours per week
Increase relevant project opportunity capture rate from 30% to 85%
Generate 3 proposal variants per project opportunity in under 5 minutes
Achieve pricing recommendations within 15% accuracy of optimal bid amounts
Support manual input of 50+ projects per week with efficient processing
Maintain 99.9% data privacy through local deployment architecture
Enable tracking of 100+ concurrent project bids across multiple platforms
Provide project matching scores with 80%+ correlation to actual project fit
constraints: Zero infrastructure cost requirement through local deployment only
Complete data privacy - no external data transmission except for AI API calls
Must share infrastructure with PRD-001 while maintaining independent business logic
Limited to manual project input methods for MVP version
Platform integrations restricted to those accessible to South Asian developers
Architecture must support future plugin expansion without core system changes
Proposal generation limited by AI API rate limits and costs
No direct platform API access for automated data retrieval in initial version
Must maintain compatibility with existing PostgreSQL and Redis infrastructure
Telegram Bot integration dependency for notification system

glossary.Project Opportunity: A freelance project posting from supported platforms that matches user criteria and skill requirements
glossary.Project-Candidate Matching: AI algorithm that scores project opportunities against user profile using project-specific weights
glossary.Pricing Intelligence: System providing competitive pricing guidance based on project complexity, budget, and historical data
glossary.Proposal Variants: Multiple versions of project proposals (Professional, Value-First, Technical) generated for the same opportunity
glossary.Bid Pipeline: Tracking system for project proposal lifecycle from draft through win/loss resolution
glossary.Plugin Adapter: Modular integration component for connecting to external platforms following Ports and Adapters pattern
glossary.Trigger Gateway API: Event-driven API system managing communication between system components
glossary.MCP Service: Model Context Protocol service for AI-powered proposal generation (future enhancement)
glossary.Win/Loss Analytics: Historical tracking of successful and unsuccessful bids to improve pricing recommendations
glossary.Project Complexity Score: AI-generated assessment of project technical difficulty and time requirements
glossary.Client Quality Score: Rating system for project clients based on platform history and payment reliability
glossary.Geographic Accessibility: Platform's openness to developers from specific regions, particularly South Asia

requirements.title: Manual Project URL Import from Freelance Platforms
requirements.description: The system must accept project URLs from supported freelance platforms (Upwork, Freelancer.com, Contra, Fiverr Pro, PeoplePerHour, Guru.com) and automatically extract project details including title, description, budget, deadline, required skills, and client information. The system must validate URL format and platform support before processing, and handle cases where URLs are inaccessible or have changed. Extracted data must be stored in the normalized project format for further processing.
requirements.rationale: Manual URL import provides the fastest way for users to capture project opportunities they discover while browsing platforms, eliminating the need to manually transcribe project details and reducing data entry errors.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test with valid URLs from each supported platform, invalid URLs, expired project URLs, and URLs requiring authentication

requirements.title: Raw Text Project Description Input
requirements.description: The system must accept unstructured text input containing project descriptions copied from any source and intelligently parse key project information including title, description, budget ranges, timeline, required skills, and client details. The system must handle various text formats, incomplete information, and multiple languages while extracting as much structured data as possible. Parsing confidence levels must be provided to users for manual verification of extracted fields.
requirements.rationale: Raw text input enables users to quickly capture project opportunities from sources without direct URL access, such as email notifications, social media posts, or platforms that don't provide shareable URLs, maximizing opportunity capture coverage.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test with project descriptions from various platforms, incomplete descriptions, multilingual text, and malformed input

requirements.title: Structured Manual Project Form Entry
requirements.description: The system must provide a guided form interface with fields for project title, description, budget (with currency selection), deadline, required skills (with auto-complete from skill database), client information, platform source, and project category. The form must include field validation, smart defaults based on user history, and the ability to save drafts for later completion. Required fields must be clearly marked and the form must support both quick entry and detailed project specification modes.
requirements.rationale: Structured form entry ensures complete and accurate project data capture when users need to manually input opportunities that cannot be parsed from URLs or text, providing a fallback method that guarantees data quality for matching and analysis algorithms.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test form validation, auto-complete functionality, draft saving, and submission with various combinations of required and optional fields

requirements.title: Project Data Normalization Engine
requirements.description: The system must convert all project data from different input methods (URL import, text parsing, manual form) into a standardized internal format with consistent field names, data types, and value ranges. The engine must normalize budget amounts to USD using current exchange rates, standardize skill names against a master skill taxonomy, convert relative deadlines to absolute dates, and extract structured metadata from unstructured descriptions. All normalization decisions must be logged for audit purposes and manual review capabilities.
requirements.rationale: Data normalization is essential for accurate project-candidate matching, pricing analysis, and deduplication across platforms, ensuring that projects from different sources can be consistently analyzed and compared regardless of their original format.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test normalization of projects from each input method, currency conversion accuracy, skill mapping consistency, and date parsing from various formats

requirements.title: Platform Registry Configuration System
requirements.description: The system must maintain a configurable registry of supported freelance platforms containing metadata such as platform name, URL patterns, geographic accessibility flags (particularly South Asian developer access), typical project categories, budget ranges, and platform-specific parsing rules. The registry must support adding new platforms, updating existing platform configurations, and enabling/disabling platforms based on user preferences. Platform configurations must include South Asian accessibility status and JavaScript/TypeScript project frequency ratings.
requirements.rationale: A configurable platform registry enables the system to adapt to new freelance platforms and changing platform policies, particularly important for tracking which platforms are accessible to South Asian developers and optimizing for JavaScript/TypeScript opportunities.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test adding new platforms, updating existing configurations, geographic accessibility filtering, and platform-specific parsing rule application

requirements.title: Project Deduplication Across Platforms
requirements.description: The system must identify and merge duplicate project postings that appear across multiple platforms using fuzzy matching algorithms on project title, description content, budget ranges, and timeline similarities. When duplicates are detected with confidence above 85%, the system must merge them into a single project record while preserving platform-specific metadata and URLs. Users must be notified of potential duplicates with confidence scores below 85% for manual review and decision.
requirements.rationale: Deduplication prevents users from wasting time analyzing and bidding on the same project multiple times across different platforms, improving efficiency and avoiding potential client confusion from multiple proposals for the same work.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test duplicate detection across different platforms, confidence scoring accuracy, automatic merging of high-confidence matches, and manual review workflow for uncertain cases

requirements.title: Project-Candidate Match Scoring Algorithm
requirements.description: The system must calculate match scores between project opportunities and user profiles using project-specific weights: 35% skill overlap, 25% budget alignment with user rate expectations, 20% project complexity versus experience match, 10% client quality score, and 10% timeline feasibility. The algorithm must generate scores from 0-100 and provide detailed breakdowns showing how each weight factor contributed to the final score.
requirements.rationale: This is the core matching engine that enables users to quickly identify the most suitable project opportunities, directly supporting the objective to increase relevant project capture rate from 30% to 85%.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Can be verified by comparing calculated scores against expected results for test project-profile combinations, and measuring correlation with user acceptance rates

requirements.title: Skill Gap Analysis for Projects
requirements.description: The system must analyze project requirements against user skills to identify missing technical skills, experience gaps, and knowledge areas that could impact project success. The analysis must categorize gaps as critical (project cannot be completed), moderate (may require learning), or minor (nice-to-have), and provide specific recommendations for skill development or partnership opportunities.
requirements.rationale: Helps users make informed decisions about project feasibility and identifies growth opportunities, supporting better project selection and professional development planning.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify by testing against projects with known skill requirements and validating gap identification accuracy

requirements.title: Client Quality Assessment Integration
requirements.description: The system must extract and analyze client quality indicators from project data including payment history, project completion rates, client reviews, response time patterns, and budget-to-scope alignment. The system must generate a client quality score from 0-100 and flag potential red flags such as unrealistic budgets, poor communication history, or payment disputes.
requirements.rationale: Protects users from problematic clients and helps prioritize high-quality opportunities, improving overall project success rates and reducing time wasted on poor-quality leads.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test with known client profiles and validate score accuracy against historical client performance data

requirements.title: JavaScript/TypeScript Technology Focus Matching
requirements.description: The system must provide enhanced matching capabilities specifically for JavaScript and TypeScript ecosystem projects, including recognition of related frameworks (React, Node.js, Vue, Angular), build tools (Webpack, Vite), testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress), and deployment platforms (Vercel, Netlify). The matching must weight JS/TS projects higher when user profile indicates specialization in these technologies and recognize transferable skills within the ecosystem.
requirements.rationale: Addresses the specific needs of our primary target audience of JavaScript/TypeScript developers by providing more accurate matching for their specialized skill set and preferred technology stack.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify by testing match scores for JS/TS projects against profiles with varying levels of ecosystem experience

requirements.title: Match Preference Customization for Projects
requirements.description: The system must allow users to customize the matching algorithm weights for project-specific preferences, adjusting the relative importance of skill overlap, budget alignment, complexity match, client quality, and timeline feasibility. Users must be able to save multiple preference profiles (e.g., 'High Budget Focus', 'Skill Development', 'Quick Turnaround') and apply them to different project searches while maintaining the default balanced approach.
requirements.rationale: Provides flexibility for users with different career strategies and project preferences, allowing them to optimize matching based on their current priorities and circumstances.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Test by creating different preference profiles and verifying that match scores change appropriately based on weight adjustments

requirements.title: Simple Price Range Suggestion Engine
requirements.description: The system must generate basic pricing recommendations for project opportunities by analyzing the posted project budget, user's configured hourly/project rates, and project scope indicators. When a project budget is available, the system must suggest a competitive price range (minimum, recommended, maximum) that positions the user competitively while maintaining profitability. For projects without budgets, the system must estimate pricing based on project description complexity and user rate preferences.
requirements.rationale: Provides immediate value to solo professionals who struggle with competitive pricing decisions, directly supporting the objective of achieving pricing recommendations within 15% accuracy of optimal bid amounts.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Can be verified by comparing suggested price ranges against actual project budgets and user rate configurations across different project types

requirements.title: AI Project Complexity Analysis
requirements.description: The system must use AI to analyze project descriptions and requirements to estimate technical complexity, time requirements, and effort multipliers. The analysis must identify key complexity factors including technology stack requirements, integration needs, custom development scope, and deliverable specifications. The system must generate a Project Complexity Score and estimated hour ranges that feed into pricing calculations, accounting for JavaScript/TypeScript project nuances and common freelance project patterns.
requirements.rationale: Enables more accurate pricing by moving beyond simple budget-based suggestions to understanding actual project effort requirements, essential for competitive positioning in technical freelance markets.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Validate by comparing AI complexity assessments against actual project completion times and effort for completed projects

requirements.title: Three-Tier Pricing Strategy Generator
requirements.description: The system must generate three distinct pricing options for each project opportunity: Economy (competitive/low-margin), Recommended (balanced value), and Premium (high-value positioning). Each tier must include different value propositions, delivery timelines, and scope considerations based on the AI Project Complexity Analysis results. The system must provide rationale for each pricing tier and suggest which approach might work best based on client quality indicators and project characteristics.
requirements.rationale: Empowers users with strategic pricing options that can be tailored to different client types and competitive situations, supporting the goal of generating multiple proposal variants efficiently.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify that all three tiers are generated with distinct pricing, timelines, and value propositions that align with complexity analysis results

requirements.title: Win/Loss Pricing Data Tracking
requirements.description: The system must capture and store win/loss outcomes for project bids correlated with the pricing strategies used, project characteristics, and client responses. The tracking must record bid amounts, pricing tier selected, project complexity factors, client feedback when available, and final outcomes. This data must be structured to enable pattern analysis for improving future pricing recommendations while maintaining complete local data privacy.
requirements.rationale: Creates a learning foundation for the pricing intelligence system, enabling continuous improvement of pricing accuracy and supporting the long-term goal of adaptive recommendations based on actual market feedback.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Confirm that bid outcomes are properly captured and linked to original pricing decisions with sufficient metadata for pattern analysis

requirements.title: Adaptive Pricing Recommendations
requirements.description: The system must analyze historical win/loss pricing data to identify successful pricing patterns and adjust future recommendations accordingly. The system must learn from user-specific bidding success rates across different project types, budget ranges, and client profiles to personalize pricing suggestions. Recommendations must evolve based on market feedback while maintaining the three-tier structure, with the system highlighting when pricing strategies deviate from historical successful patterns.
requirements.rationale: Represents the advanced tier of pricing intelligence that transforms the system from static recommendations to a learning system that improves pricing accuracy over time based on actual market results.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Validate that pricing recommendations change over time based on win/loss data and that suggested adjustments correlate with improved success rates

requirements.title: Short Proposal Generation with Variants
requirements.description: The system must generate three distinct variants of short proposals (200-400 words each) for any project opportunity: Professional (formal tone, emphasizing credentials and methodology), Value-First (focusing on ROI and business outcomes), and Technical (highlighting technical expertise and implementation details). Each variant must be contextually relevant to the project requirements and include relevant skills, proposed approach, and competitive positioning.
requirements.rationale: Different clients respond to different proposal styles, and having multiple variants significantly increases the chance of winning projects while saving time compared to manually writing custom proposals for each opportunity.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify each variant meets word count requirements, contains distinct tone and focus areas, and incorporates project-specific details from the match scoring analysis

requirements.title: Detailed Proposal with Timeline and Milestones
requirements.description: The system must generate comprehensive proposals that include project breakdown into phases, detailed timeline with milestones, deliverable specifications, risk assessment, and itemized pricing structure. The detailed proposal must build upon the selected short proposal variant and expand it with technical approach, resource allocation, quality assurance processes, and client communication plan.
requirements.rationale: Complex projects require detailed proposals to demonstrate thorough understanding and professional project management capabilities, which increases win rates for high-value opportunities.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify proposal contains all required sections, timeline is realistic based on project complexity, and pricing aligns with the three-tier strategy

requirements.title: Proposal Personalization Engine
requirements.description: The system must customize all generated proposals by incorporating user's specific skills, relevant past experience, portfolio highlights, and preferred working methodologies from their profile. Personalization must adapt language, technical depth, and emphasis based on project requirements and client preferences while maintaining consistency with the user's professional brand and communication style.
requirements.rationale: Generic proposals have low success rates; personalization ensures proposals reflect the user's unique value proposition and increases client engagement by demonstrating relevant expertise.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify proposals contain user-specific skills and experience relevant to the project, and maintain consistent tone with user's professional profile

requirements.title: Proposal Version History Management
requirements.description: The system must maintain complete version history for all proposals generated for each project, allowing users to compare different versions, track changes, and revert to previous versions. The system must store metadata including generation timestamp, variant type, user modifications, and performance outcomes when available, enabling users to identify the most effective proposal approaches over time.
requirements.rationale: Version control enables users to iterate on proposals, learn from successful approaches, and maintain audit trails for client communications and business development optimization.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify all proposal versions are stored with complete metadata, users can access and compare any historical version, and changes are tracked accurately

requirements.title: Proposal Export in Multiple Formats
requirements.description: The system must export generated proposals in multiple formats including PDF with professional formatting, plain text for platform text boxes, and platform-specific formatted versions optimized for major freelance platforms. Each export format must preserve proposal content while adapting layout, formatting, and structure to match the target platform's requirements and best practices.
requirements.rationale: Different platforms have varying submission requirements and formatting constraints; multiple export formats ensure proposals can be submitted efficiently across all target platforms without manual reformatting.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify exported proposals maintain content integrity across all formats, PDF formatting is professional and readable, and platform-specific exports meet target platform requirements

requirements.title: Project Bid Lifecycle Management
requirements.description: The system must track the complete lifecycle of project bids through defined stages: Drafted, Submitted, Viewed, Shortlisted, Interview/Call, Won, Lost, and Withdrawn. Each status transition must be recorded with timestamps and maintain a complete audit trail. The system must allow manual status updates by users and support bulk status changes for multiple bids simultaneously.
requirements.rationale: Tracking bid lifecycle is essential for understanding project pursuit effectiveness and maintaining organized follow-up activities, directly supporting the objective to track 100+ concurrent project bids.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify status transitions are recorded with accurate timestamps and that all lifecycle stages are supported

requirements.title: Bid Metadata Capture System
requirements.description: The system must capture and store comprehensive metadata for each bid including submission date, proposal version used, pricing submitted, target platform, client contact information, project deadline, and any custom notes. All metadata must be editable after creation and support bulk export for analysis. The system must link bid metadata to the corresponding project opportunity and proposal version.
requirements.rationale: Detailed bid metadata enables pricing intelligence improvements, win/loss analysis, and provides context for follow-up activities, supporting the 15% pricing accuracy objective.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Confirm all specified metadata fields are captured and properly linked to proposals and projects

requirements.title: Project Bid Kanban Board Interface
requirements.description: The system must provide a visual Kanban board interface specifically for project bids, separate from the job applications board in PRD-001. The board must display bid cards organized by lifecycle status columns with drag-and-drop functionality for status updates. Each card must show key information including project title, client name, bid amount, submission date, and current status with color-coded priority indicators.
requirements.rationale: Visual bid management improves user productivity and provides quick overview of bid pipeline status, supporting efficient tracking of 100+ concurrent bids across multiple platforms.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify Kanban board displays correctly, drag-drop updates status, and remains separate from job applications interface

requirements.title: Bid Follow-up Reminder System
requirements.description: The system must generate automated follow-up reminders for submitted bids based on configurable timeframes and bid status. Reminders must be sent via Telegram Bot integration and include bid details, days since submission, and suggested follow-up actions. Users must be able to customize reminder schedules, snooze reminders, and mark bids as 'no follow-up needed' to suppress future alerts.
requirements.rationale: Automated follow-up reminders ensure no opportunities are missed due to lack of communication, improving bid success rates and client relationship management.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Confirm reminders are generated at correct intervals, Telegram notifications work, and snooze functionality operates properly

requirements.title: Bid Analytics and Success Rate Tracking
requirements.description: The system must generate comprehensive analytics on bid performance including success rates by platform, average response times, earnings per platform, and bid-to-win conversion rates. Analytics must provide trend analysis over time periods and identify patterns in successful bids. The system must generate exportable reports and dashboard visualizations showing key performance indicators for bid activities.
requirements.rationale: Bid analytics provide insights for improving proposal strategies and platform selection, enabling data-driven decisions to increase the 30% to 85% opportunity capture rate objective.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify analytics calculations are accurate, reports generate correctly, and dashboard displays meaningful insights

requirements.title: Project Discovery Dashboard with Card Layout
requirements.description: The system must provide a dedicated project discovery dashboard displaying freelance project opportunities in a card-based layout. Each project card must show match score, budget range, required skills, client rating, platform source, and deadline. The dashboard must be separate from the job application dashboard and support pagination for efficient browsing of large project datasets.
requirements.rationale: Provides the primary interface for users to quickly scan and evaluate project opportunities, enabling efficient project discovery that reduces browsing time from 10+ hours to under 2 hours per week.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify card displays all required metadata fields, pagination works with 50+ projects, and dashboard loads within performance requirements

requirements.title: Project Detail View with Analysis
requirements.description: The system must provide a comprehensive project detail view accessible from the project dashboard cards. The detail view must display full project description, detailed skill match analysis with gap identification, client profile information, pricing analysis with recommendations, and direct access to proposal generation variants. The view must integrate analysis from REQ-007 (match scoring), REQ-012 (pricing), and REQ-017 (proposals).
requirements.rationale: Enables informed decision-making by providing all necessary project analysis in a single view, supporting the objective of increasing relevant project opportunity capture rate to 85%.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify all analysis components display correctly, proposal generation is accessible, and view integrates data from matching, pricing, and proposal systems

requirements.title: Advanced Project Filtering and Sorting
requirements.description: The system must provide comprehensive filtering and sorting capabilities for the project dashboard. Filtering options must include platform source, budget range, required skills, match score threshold, project deadline, and client quality rating. Sorting must support match score, budget, deadline, and submission date in ascending/descending order. Filters must be combinable and persist during user session.
requirements.rationale: Enables users to quickly focus on the most relevant opportunities based on their preferences and constraints, improving the efficiency of project discovery and supporting the goal of capturing 85% of relevant opportunities.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify all filter combinations work correctly, sorting maintains stability, and filter state persists across page refreshes

requirements.title: Unified Search Across Jobs and Projects
requirements.description: The system must provide an optional unified search interface that allows users to search across both job applications (from PRD-001) and project opportunities simultaneously. The unified view must clearly distinguish between job and project results, maintain separate filtering options for each type, and allow users to toggle between unified and separate views. Search must support keyword matching across titles, descriptions, and skills.
requirements.rationale: Serves users who pursue both employment and freelance projects simultaneously by providing a consolidated view of all opportunities, improving workflow efficiency for this target user segment.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify search returns results from both systems, result types are clearly distinguished, and toggle between views works seamlessly

requirements.title: Project Notification System Integration
requirements.description: The system must integrate with the notification system to provide real-time alerts for project-related events. Notifications must include new projects matching user criteria, bid status changes, approaching project deadlines, and client responses. Notifications must be configurable by type and delivery method (in-app, Telegram bot integration via REQ-036), and include direct links to relevant project detail views.
requirements.rationale: Ensures users don't miss time-sensitive opportunities and can respond quickly to project developments, supporting the objective of capturing 85% of relevant opportunities through timely awareness.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify notifications trigger correctly for each event type, configuration options work, and links navigate to correct project views

requirements.title: Shared Docker Infrastructure with PRD-001
requirements.description: The system must utilize the existing Docker containerized infrastructure from PRD-001, including shared PostgreSQL database, Redis cache, and Docker networking. The project opportunity system must deploy as additional containers within the same Docker Compose environment while maintaining complete logical separation of business logic and data schemas. Database isolation must be achieved through separate schemas or table prefixes, and Redis keyspace isolation through namespace prefixes.
requirements.rationale: Sharing infrastructure with PRD-001 eliminates duplicate infrastructure costs and complexity while maintaining the zero-cost deployment constraint. This approach leverages existing stable infrastructure while ensuring independent operation of both systems.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify containers deploy successfully in existing environment, database schemas remain isolated, and Redis keyspaces don't conflict

requirements.title: Plugin Adapter Architecture for Platforms
requirements.description: The system must implement a pluggable adapter architecture following the Ports and Adapters pattern for integrating with freelance platforms. Each platform adapter must implement a standardized interface for project data extraction, normalization, and platform-specific operations. The plugin registry must support dynamic loading of adapters without core system changes, with each adapter handling platform-specific authentication, rate limiting, and data formatting requirements.
requirements.rationale: The pluggable architecture enables future expansion to new platforms without modifying core system logic, supporting the constraint of platform integrations accessible to South Asian developers while maintaining extensibility for future automated integrations.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify new adapters can be added without core changes, standardized interface is enforced, and platform-specific operations are properly isolated

requirements.title: Trigger Gateway API for Project Operations
requirements.description: The system must provide a RESTful Trigger Gateway API with endpoints for all project-related operations including project creation, updates, proposal generation triggers, and bid status changes. The API must support both synchronous operations for immediate responses and asynchronous operations for long-running tasks like AI proposal generation. All API endpoints must include proper authentication, input validation, and error handling with standardized response formats.
requirements.rationale: The Trigger Gateway API serves as the central coordination point for all project operations, enabling integration with external systems like Telegram Bot while maintaining loose coupling between system components and supporting future MCP service extraction.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify all CRUD operations work correctly, asynchronous operations return proper job IDs, and error responses follow standard format

requirements.title: Event-Driven Communication via BullMQ
requirements.description: The system must implement event-driven communication using BullMQ for asynchronous processing of project operations including proposal generation, match scoring calculations, pricing analysis, and notification triggers. Events must be properly queued with appropriate retry mechanisms, dead letter handling, and job progress tracking. The system must support priority queues for time-sensitive operations and batch processing for bulk project imports.
requirements.rationale: Event-driven architecture ensures responsive user experience by offloading time-consuming operations like AI proposal generation to background processes, while providing reliable processing of the target 50+ projects per week with proper error handling and retry mechanisms.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify events are properly queued and processed, retry mechanisms work for failed jobs, and job progress can be tracked

requirements.title: Telegram Bot Integration for Project Management
requirements.description: The system must integrate with the existing Telegram Bot infrastructure to provide project management commands including project status updates, new opportunity notifications, proposal generation triggers, and bid tracking summaries. Bot commands must support quick actions like marking projects as applied, updating bid status, and requesting project summaries. All bot interactions must maintain the same authentication and security standards as the web interface.
requirements.rationale: Telegram Bot integration provides mobile-friendly access to project management functions, enabling users to stay updated on opportunities and manage their bid pipeline without requiring constant web interface access, supporting the goal of efficient project opportunity management.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify bot commands execute correctly, notifications are delivered promptly, and authentication is properly maintained across bot interactions

requirements.title: MCP-Ready Proposal Engine Interface
requirements.description: The system must design the proposal generation engine with a clean interface suitable for future extraction into a standalone Model Context Protocol (MCP) service. The interface must abstract AI provider interactions, maintain stateless operation for proposal generation, and support standardized input/output formats compatible with MCP specifications. The current implementation must remain embedded while ensuring future service extraction requires minimal code changes.
requirements.rationale: Future-proofing the proposal engine for MCP extraction enables potential monetization as a standalone service while maintaining current embedded operation, supporting long-term product evolution without requiring immediate architectural changes.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify proposal engine interface is properly abstracted, stateless operation is maintained, and input/output formats are standardized

requirements.title: Project Discovery Performance Under 2 Seconds
requirements.description: The project discovery dashboard and search operations must complete within 2 seconds for datasets containing up to 1000 active projects, including match score calculations, filtering operations, and result rendering. Database queries must be optimized with appropriate indexing on frequently searched fields (skills, budget, deadline, match scores), and the system must implement caching strategies for expensive operations like match score calculations. Performance must be measured from user action initiation to complete page rendering.
requirements.rationale: Fast project discovery is critical for user productivity and adoption, as users need to quickly scan through multiple opportunities to identify the most promising projects for bidding within their limited time budget.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Performance test with varying dataset sizes, concurrent user loads, different search and filter combinations, and measure end-to-end response times

requirements.title: Support 50+ Weekly Project Input Processing
requirements.description: The system must handle the input and processing of 50 or more project opportunities per week without performance degradation, maintaining response times under 5 seconds for each project input method (URL import, text parsing, form entry). The system must queue processing tasks appropriately, provide progress feedback to users during batch operations, and maintain data integrity under high-volume input scenarios. Processing must include full normalization, deduplication checks, and match score calculation for each project.
requirements.rationale: High-volume project processing capability is essential for power users who want to capture maximum opportunity coverage across multiple platforms, supporting the objective of increasing relevant project opportunity capture rate to 85%.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Load test with 50+ projects per week, measure processing times under sustained load, test data integrity with concurrent inputs, and verify queue management effectiveness

requirements.title: Concurrent Tracking of 100+ Project Bids
requirements.description: The system must efficiently handle concurrent tracking of at least 100 active project bids across multiple platforms without performance degradation. Database queries for bid retrieval must execute within 500ms, and the Kanban board must load all bid cards within 2 seconds. The system must support pagination and filtering to manage large bid volumes while maintaining responsive user interactions.
requirements.rationale: Supporting high-volume bid tracking enables users to pursue maximum opportunities across multiple platforms, directly supporting the objective to track 100+ concurrent project bids.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Load test with 100+ bids to verify response times meet requirements and user interface remains responsive

requirements.title: Proposal Generation Under 5 Minutes
requirements.description: The system must generate all three short proposal variants within 5 minutes of user initiation, including AI processing time, personalization, and formatting. The system must provide progress indicators during generation and handle AI API timeouts gracefully by implementing retry logic and fallback mechanisms to ensure consistent performance within the time constraint.
requirements.rationale: Fast proposal generation is critical for capturing time-sensitive opportunities and maintaining user productivity, as delays can result in missed project deadlines or reduced competitive advantage.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Measure end-to-end generation time under various load conditions and verify system meets 5-minute constraint in 95% of cases

requirements.title: Local Data Privacy with Zero External Transmission
requirements.description: The system must ensure complete data privacy by storing all project data, client information, proposals, and user preferences locally within the Docker infrastructure. No project-related data may be transmitted to external services except for AI API calls during proposal generation, which must only send sanitized project requirements without client-identifying information. All external API calls must be logged and auditable, with user consent required for any data transmission.
requirements.rationale: Zero external data transmission ensures complete data privacy and security for sensitive project and client information, addressing privacy concerns while maintaining the local deployment constraint and building user trust through transparent data handling.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify no project data leaves local environment except sanitized AI calls, all external requests are logged, and user consent mechanisms work properly

requirements.title: AI API Rate Limit Management
requirements.description: The system must implement intelligent rate limit management for AI API calls including request queuing, exponential backoff for rate limit errors, cost tracking per proposal generation, and user notifications when approaching rate limits. The system must optimize API usage by batching requests where possible and implementing local caching for repeated content patterns to minimize API costs while maintaining proposal quality.
requirements.rationale: AI API costs and rate limits directly impact system operational costs and user experience; proper management ensures sustainable operation while preventing service disruptions during peak usage periods.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify system handles rate limit responses correctly, tracks API usage accurately, and maintains service availability during rate limit periods

requirements.title: Project Data Encryption at Rest
requirements.description: The system must encrypt sensitive project data at rest in the local PostgreSQL database, including client contact information, project descriptions, proposal content, and pricing data. Encryption must use industry-standard AES-256 encryption with proper key management stored separately from encrypted data. The system must support transparent encryption/decryption during normal operations while maintaining query performance for project discovery and matching operations.
requirements.rationale: Encrypting sensitive data at rest provides additional security layer protecting against unauthorized access to the local database, ensuring client confidentiality and competitive proposal information remains secure even if the local system is compromised.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Verify sensitive data is properly encrypted in database, decryption works transparently during operations, and query performance remains acceptable

requirements.title: Match Score Accuracy Above 80% Correlation
requirements.description: The project matching algorithm must achieve at least 80% correlation between calculated match scores and actual project fit as measured by user acceptance rates, successful bid outcomes, and project completion satisfaction. The system must track and analyze matching performance over time, automatically flagging when correlation drops below the 80% threshold and providing insights for algorithm improvement.
requirements.rationale: Ensures the matching algorithm provides genuine value by accurately predicting project suitability, directly supporting the objective to increase relevant project opportunity capture rate to 85%.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Measure through A/B testing, user feedback collection, and statistical analysis of match scores versus actual user project selection and success rates

requirements.title: Pricing Recommendation Accuracy Within 15%
requirements.description: The pricing recommendation system must achieve accuracy within 15% of optimal bid amounts, where optimal is defined as the highest price that would still win the project based on historical data and competitive analysis. The system must track this accuracy metric across different project types, budget ranges, and complexity levels, providing feedback on recommendation quality and identifying areas where pricing intelligence needs improvement.
requirements.rationale: Ensures the pricing intelligence system delivers measurable business value by providing recommendations that are competitive yet profitable, directly supporting the product objective of achieving pricing recommendations within 15% accuracy.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Measure by comparing recommended prices against actual winning bid amounts for similar projects, tracking accuracy percentages across different project categories

requirements.title: System Availability 99.9% Uptime
requirements.description: The system must maintain 99.9% availability (less than 8.76 hours downtime per year) for all core project management functions including project discovery, proposal generation, bid tracking, and data access. The system must implement automated health checks, graceful error handling, and recovery mechanisms to ensure continuous operation of critical freelancer workflows even during component failures or maintenance operations.
requirements.rationale: High availability is critical for freelancers who depend on the system for time-sensitive project opportunities and proposal submissions. System downtime directly impacts their ability to capture project opportunities and could result in missed business opportunities worth thousands of dollars.
requirements.testabilityNotes: Measure actual uptime over extended periods, test graceful degradation during component failures, verify automated recovery mechanisms, and validate health check effectiveness
